document.docAuthor: Narita, João P. Z., De, Gilberto J. & Fernando, Liyanage C. P.
document.masterDocTitle: Two species of Neocypholaelaps from Sri Lanka (Acari: Ameroseiidae), with description of a new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two species of Neocypholaelaps from Sri Lanka (Acari: Ameroseiidae), with description of a new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gnathosoma (
Fig. 2
A): Fixed cheliceral digit 40 long, apparently with two small, transversely aligned teeth next to the apical tooth; with a membranous lobe externally attached to digit; movable chelicerae digit 35 ( 33–37 ) long, edentate. Epistome with anterior margin w-shaped and denticulate; with a row of longitudinal lines immediately behind anterior margin, giving to this region a plicate appearance; with a row of denticles behind the row of longitudinal lines. Hypostomal setae with the following lengths:
h 1
28 ;
h 2
23 ,
h 3
40 , sc 32 .

Dorsal idiosoma: Dorsal shield entire, totally reticulated; reticula formed by single continuous lines; 583–600 long and 467 wide at level of
s 6
. Dorsal seta lengths:
j 1
46 ( 45–47 ),
j 2
37 ( 35–39 ),
j 3
36 ( 35–37 ),

stout and barbed; other setae stout and smooth.

Spermathecal apparatus (
Fig. 2
B): Induction pore apparently at postero-proximal region of coxa III; infundibulum ( 37 long) distinctly wider than tubulus ( 275 long), leading to wider ramus ( 10 long). Rami distinctly separated from each other when connecting to the sacculus.
Legs: All legs with pulvilli and claws. Length of the legs: I – 614 ; II – 512 ; III – 507 ; IV – 657 .

Gnathosoma: Fixed cheliceral digit 50 long, apparently with two small, transversely aligned teeth next to the apical tooth; with a membranous lobe externally attached to digit; movable cheliceral digit 45 long. Epistome with anterior margin slightly convex and denticulate; other structures observed in females not distinguishable. Spermatodactyl 68 ( 65–70 ) long. Hypostomal setae lengths:
h 1
40 ;
h 2
25 ;
h 3
42 , sc 30 .
Legs: All legs with pulvilli and claws. Length of the legs: I – 658 ; II – 552 ; III – 545 ; IV – 757 .

Material examined. Two females from inflorescences of
C . nucifera
; Urapola ( 7 o 10 ’ N, 80 o08’ E); July, 2003 ; two males from inflorescences of
C . nucifera
; Mirigama; July, 2003 . All specimens collected by G. J. de Moraes and deposited at Departamento de Entomologia e Acarologia, Escola Superior de Agricultura “Luiz de Queiroz”, Universidade de São Paulo, Piracicaba, State of São Paulo, Brazil .

Remarks. At least part of the females and males examined in the original description of this species were slightly larger than the specimens collected in this study. That is compatible with the slightly larger dimensions of the few setae and of the anal shield for the former specimens, mentioned in the original description.
